data.title: Best Email Hosting Services (2024)
data.meta_description: Forbes Advisor evaluated several email hosting services, seeking the best options for small businesses. Here are the top five email hosting services of 2024.

Best email hosting services of 2024

DreamHost: Best overall

SiteGround: Best for resellers and service providers

A2 Hosting: Best for security

Zoho Mail: Best for flexibility

Google Workspace: Best all-in-one platform

Why you can trust Forbes Advisor Small Business

The Forbes Advisor Small Business team is committed to bringing you unbiased rankings and information with full editorial independence. We use product data, strategic methodologies and expert insights to inform all of our content and guide you in making the best decisions for your business journey.

We reviewed providers using a complex scoring methodology to help you find the five best email hosting services for small businesses. Our ratings consider factors such as price per user, number of features available and a review by our experts based on the opinions of real users. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

FEATURED PARTNER OFFER

BEST OVERALL EMAIL HOSTING SERVICE

DreamHost

4.9

Our ratings take into account a product's rewards, fees, rates and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Price

£1.27 ($1.67)* to £1.52 ($1.99)*

per mailbox per month (depending on payment terms)

Storage

25 GB per mailbox

Attachment size limit

Not applicable

Learn More

On DreamHost's Secure Website

Price

£1.27 ($1.67)* to £1.52 ($1.99)*

per mailbox per month (depending on payment terms)

Storage

25 GB per mailbox

Attachment size limit

Not applicable

Why We Picked It

DreamHost delivers a rich feature set with a consistent and easy user experience across multiple platforms at an affordable price. DreamHost comes with webmail built-in, and syncs messages across mobile and desktop devices to ensure users don’t miss a single message.

DreamHost is constantly updating its anti-spam features so that customers are a step ahead of the spammers. The company also has strong virus and anti-phishing tools to protect your inbox from cybercriminals.

Who should use it. DreamHost is great for SMBs. You don’t have to be a tech expert to get up and running or to protect yourself from phishing attacks and spam.

* Converted on the 14 July 2023

Pros & Cons

Low cost

Large inbox size

Popular with WordPress users

Pricing structure of different packages can be unclear

FEATURED PARTNER OFFER

BEST FOR RESELLERS AND SERVICE PROVIDERS

SiteGround

4.4

Our ratings take into account a product's rewards, fees, rates and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Price

£2.99 to £7.49

per month

Storage

Unlimited

Attachment size limit

Not applicable

Price

£2.99 to £7.49

per month

Storage

Unlimited

Attachment size limit

Not applicable

Why We Picked It

SiteGround provides a full complement of hosting services, including email, website and WordPress site hosting. The solution supports an unlimited number of users per domain as well as unlimited inbox sizes. This should be particularly handy for businesses with high volumes of emails and/or a large user base.

Administrators can manage email through a central panel and configure automated forwarding and responders. The solution also supports SMTP, IMAP and POP3, which makes it a great fit in any environment.

Who should use it. SiteGround is ideal for businesses that host WordPress sites or use WooCommerce (managed WordPress e-commerce hosting solution). SiteGround is an ideal platform for resellers and service providers to host their customers’ solutions.

Pros & Cons

Unlimited inbox size

24/7 support

Excellent customer reviews

Not great for businesses that only require email hosting

FEATURED PARTNER OFFER

BEST FOR SECURITY

A2 Hosting

4.3

Our ratings take into account a product's rewards, fees, rates and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

£1.21 ($1.59)* to £1.97 ($2.59)*

per month (depending on package and payment terms)

Storage

10 GB to 30 GB

(depending on package)

Attachment size limit

Not applicable

Learn More

On A2 Hosting's Secure Website

Price

£1.21 ($1.59)* to £1.97 ($2.59)*

per month (depending on package and payment terms)

Storage

10 GB to 30 GB

(depending on package)

Attachment size limit

Not applicable

Why We Picked It

A2 Hosting is feature-rich, providing unlimited email addresses, spam protection, preinstalled webmail software and automated email forwarding and responding.

A2 Hosting works with POP3, IMAP and SMTP, and comes with popular email clients preinstalled, which makes it a great fit for any SMB. Support for Contact Form 7 and integration with phpList, Dada Mail and poMMo make it easy for businesses to automate and enhance customer communications processes.

Who should use it. A2 Hosting’s security features make it a solid fit for any business that prioritises keeping data safe.

* Converted on the 14 July 2023

Pros & Cons

Unlimited inbox size

Money-back guarantee

You must purchase web hosting to use mail-hosting services

FEATURED PARTNER OFFER

BEST FOR FLEXIBILITY

Zoho Mail

3.8

Our ratings take into account a product's rewards, fees, rates and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Price

£0.80 to £2.40

per user per month/billed annually

Storage

5 GB to unlimited

Attachment size limit

250 MB to 1 GB

Price

£0.80 to £2.40

per user per month/billed annually

Storage

5 GB to unlimited

Attachment size limit

250 MB to 1 GB

Why We Picked It

Zoho Mail offers a well-rounded feature set, including hosting for multiple domains, domain aliases, email recall and more. The solution supports “events,” “tasks,” and “notes.” The former makes it easy for users to schedule events, while the latter two can be used to plan, track and collaborate on processes. When events, tasks and notes are created within emails, there’s a neat feature that allows users to @mention others to make sure messages don’t slip through the cracks.

Zoho’s commitment to security played a big role in making Forbes Advisor’s Best Email Hosting Services list. All data is encrypted during transfer and at rest, and security policies can be created to quarantine or reject unauthorised emails. The solution also comes with malware detection capabilities and enables administrators to set email policies to prevent data leaks. Email retention, audits and eDiscovery functionality are also useful for investigating breaches.

Who should use it. Zoho Mail has email hosting packages for everyone. The Mail Lite version is great for front desk staff, contract employees and frequent travelers, while the premium version is better for power users, senior technical professionals and IT professionals.

Pros & Cons

Send attachments up to 1 GB in size

Money-back guarantee

Integration with optional business productivity apps from Zoho

Per-user pricing can be expensive for large businesses

FEATURED PARTNER OFFER

BEST ALL-IN-ONE PLATFORM

Google Workspace

3.5

Our ratings take into account a product's rewards, fees, rates and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Price

£5 to £15

per user per month, depending on package

Storage

30 GB to 5 TB

Attachment size limit

25 MB

Price

£5 to £15

per user per month, depending on package

Storage

30 GB to 5 TB

Attachment size limit

25 MB

Why We Picked It

Gmail is one of the most commonly used email solutions, with 1.8 billion users across the globe. Given its massive user base, most will be familiar with the look and feel and functionality of Gmail, so you can spend less time training employees. Gmail also offers tight integration with the rest of the Google Workspace suite.

All of Gmail’s plans come with security features like 2FA, group-based policy controls (to ensure users only see the data that they are authorised to see) and end point management tools. Gmail also leverages AI to block spam, phishing emails and malware.

Who should use it. Google Workspace is a good choice for SMBs. Google Workspace provides businesses with an email hosting platform plus an entire suite of office productivity applications like Google Drive, Calendar, Meet and more.

Pros & Cons

Tight integrations with the rest of the Google Workplace suite

Smart reply and smart compose features helps workers write emails faster and with fewer errors

Higher per-user license costs

Summary: Best Email Hosting Services

What is email hosting?

Email hosting refers to the technology that stores your email messages, files and other information on a remote server. Email hosting services also make it easy to set up and deploy individual email accounts for your employees. Whether it’s your personal email address, such as a Gmail account, or a work account, all email activity is hosted in some way, shape or form.

Which email hosting service is right for me?

Finding the right email hosting solution for your business is a function of your needs. You have to consider factors like your industry, existing information technology (IT) environment, headcount, inbox and attachment size requirements, feature requirements and more.

If you need to support a lot of users, you probably want something with volume discounting. If you are in an industry that is disproportionately targeted by cybercriminals, then you should consider security-focused providers.

Essential features

While there’s no universal checklist of essential email hosting service features, there are some basic factors to consider.

Inbox size: Optimising storage is crucial for effectively managing your emails, while minimising IT costs. If your inbox size is too small, you may constantly run out of space, rendering your email useless. If you choose an inbox size that is much larger than what is required, then you’ll be paying for capacity that goes unused

Attachment size: Take into account the size and frequency of file attachments in your emails. If your business frequently sends or receives large files, then you might need an email hosting service provider that supports oversized attachments (you will need to take this into consideration when determining which inbox size you require)

Security tools: Protecting your emails and data is essential. At the very least, your email hosting service should offer end-to-end encryption, spam filtering, malware scanning and integration with multifactor authentication platforms. Depending on the industry you work in, you might require additional features to keep secure data and comply with regulations

Calendar functionality: Email and calendar functionality can be vital to enabling collaborative working environments. When you are considering your next email hosting service provider, make sure its calendar functionalities meet your needs or integrate with your workforce management platform

Mobile apps: Nearly half of all emails are opened on a mobile device. Before you commit to an email hosting service, make sure its mobile app supports your must-have features, and works with the mobile platforms that your employees use to get the job done.

Support and ease of use

Checking a hosting service offers essential features for your business is fairly clear cut, but finding a system that feels right to employees, and isn’t too complex for your IT team, can be tricky.

If the system is difficult for employees to adopt and master, or too difficult for your IT team to deploy and manage, then it will lead to inefficiencies that can cut into or completely wipe out any expected ROI.

Before you settle on a hosting platform, you’ll need to explore how it looks and feels in your environment. Read reviews from reputable technology experts and watch demos online to see the platform in action. You may also be able to take advantage of free trials so you can try before you buy.

Free versus paid-for services

Once you’ve defined your needs and start exploring options, you might wonder if you can get by using a free email hosting service.

In some cases, you might be able to get by on the limited features, features, inbox storage and attachment size that comes with free email hosting services, and save some cash each year.

If your business is small, you can always upgrade to a paid plan as your needs and requirements change.

However, skimping on email hosting will not always be the most cost-effective option in the long run. Email is a relatively inexpensive IT service, and paid packages unlock a bounty of productivity-enhancing features and useful integrations that could effectively pay for themselves.

If you’re already paying for web hosting, you may also be able to add email to your package for a small upcharge.

Relying on free email hosting could also leave your business vulnerable to serious cybersecurity threats. After all, many cybersecurity events start when someone opens an email. Free email hosting services don’t typically come with the additional protections offered in paid packages that can prevent your business from becoming the next victim of a cyberattack.

How much does email hosting cost?

The cost of your email hosting service will depend on several factors, including the size of your business, the tier of the service you are purchasing, the term and payment frequency of your plan, upcharges for add-on features and increased storage capacity, and the hosting environment (multi-tenant versus dedicated hosting).

To give you an idea of how much an email hosting service typically costs, let’s use three hypothetical businesses as an example. Each business has different email hosting requirements and preferences, and we will compare how much it will cost them to use some of the most popular email hosting services in 2024.

Small businesses

Imagine a small massage parlor in a big city with 25 employees. Most employees don’t spend a lot of time using email, so the parlor doesn’t need a lot of bells and whistles — they just need an email hosting service that provides them with a secure and reliable communications channel.

The parlor settles on Zoho Mail Workplace plan. It comes with 30GB of mail storage and 5GB of inbox storage per user. At £2.40 per user, they only have to spend £60 a month to ensure everyone is connected.

Medium businesses

Our hypothetical medium-sized company uses its 100 employees to deliver marketing services in its local region. It needs a fast and reliable email hosting service that offers enough web space and bandwidth for its multiple websites, and that includes some advanced features such as caching, backups and priority support. It also needs some custom domain and branding options to enhance its professional image.

The medium-sized business subscribes to SiteGround’s GoGeek plan because they like the fixed amount for each website they host, and that each domain comes with support for unlimited email accounts.

The cost for this plan would be £6.99 per month for the first year and £34.99 per month afterward.

Larger businesses

Our theoretical large business is a financial services provider with 500 employees and multiple offices. They lean on Google Workspace for their email hosting needs because of its scalable architecture that offers as much storage as needed, advanced security features and compliance controls. It also fills their need for productivity and collaboration tools to enhance its workflow and communication.

For this large business, the Enterprise plan would be the best option, as it includes custom and secure business email, 1,000 participant video meetings with recording, attendance tracking, noise cancellation, in-domain live streaming, as much storage as needed, S/MIME encryption for emails, advanced security, management and compliance controls, and premium support.

The cost for this plan has custom pricing depending on the number of users and features required. For 500 users, assuming they need an average of 10GB of storage per user, the estimated cost would be around £24 per user per month with a yearly plan or £29 per user per month with a monthly plan. For 500 users, the total cost would be around £12,000 per month with a yearly plan or £14,500 per month with a monthly plan.

Methodology

To choose the email hosting providers for this ranking, Forbes Advisor compared each company based on important factors that include features and pricing.

We ranked each company on these factors based on a five-star rating system, with the highest score being five out of five stars. Our criteria were similar to that we applied to our guide to the best web hosting services but with some changes to account for email-specific needs.

Pricing

Email hosting pricing models and total costs were evaluated based on per-user pricing and volume discounting. Those providers whose pricing was considered to be cheap or midrange fared the best. Pricing accounted for 30% of our weighted scoring.

Features

We compared email hosting providers based on their functions and features, giving preference to providers with the most useful features and tools. Among these included whether a provider offered security tools and calendar functionality, made a mobile app available, offered inbox sizes of at least 20 GB and allowed for attachment sizes of at least 10 MB. We weighted features at 40% of our total score.

Expert analysis

Vendors should make it easy for customers to get in touch with support staff in case they need help. That was one of the many factors that real users mentioned in third-party reviews, and our experts scoured these reviews to gauge opinions of these email hosting services.

Additionally, we researched reviews to get users’ opinions related to ease of use, stand-out features, popularity and value for the money. Our experts’ analysis made up 30% of the total score.
